message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with the problem of text removal in real scenes, which is a computer vision task. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The proposed method uses a conditional adversarial generative network (cGAN) with an auxiliary mask, which involves deep learning techniques and can be considered as an artificial intelligence approach, hence cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely. The paper also mentions achieving state-of-the-art results on several datasets, which suggests that machine learning and optimization techniques are involved, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with text detection and inpainting, which are information retrieval and natural language processing tasks, respectively, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) possible sub-categories as well.
